newsitem.title: POLAND: POLAND SHOULD END DUTY FREE GRAIN IMPORTS - MINISTER.
newsitem.headline: POLAND SHOULD END DUTY FREE GRAIN IMPORTS - MINISTER.

text.p: Polish Agriculture Minister Roman Jagielinski said on Wednesday he would ask the government to quickly restore customs duties on grains imports, suspened until July this year.
"I will submit a motion to suspend the duty free (grains) imports at the nearest government meeting," Jagielinski told a news conference.
He said the duty, if reintroduced, would not apply to grains imported under contracts already signed.
Jagielinski, who earlier wanted to end duty free grains imports on March 31, now said the tarrif should be restored as soon as the government passes a relevant regulation.

Jagielinski said the 20-percent duty should be restored because the domestic grains market has stabilised after substancial imports and outlook for grains output this year promised strong domestic supply.

Earlier this year, the parliament's agriculture committee recommended the reintroduction of the duty and Jagielinski is also pressured to push it through by his colleagues from the Polish Peasant Party.
According to newspaper reports, Jagielinski's earlier attempts to reinstate the grains imports duty have been blocked by the finance minister, concerned it might boost inflation.
